The phrase "hole mobilities" is the only property name mentioned in the paragraph. It is mentioned in relation to the materials P1, P3, P4, P5, and P7. The values of the hole mobilities are given in the paragraph, but the property name itself is the only entity that needs to be identified.

The phrase "hole mobilities" refers to a material property that describes how easily holes (positive charges) can move through a material. It is a common property used to characterize semiconductors and other electronic materials. In this case, the hole mobilities of several polymers are being compared.
